PageTitle: oam-bind ingress vrrp vrid egress cfm md ma
FuncDef:
The oam-bind ingress vrrp vrid egress cfm md ma command enables VRRP to instruct the MGR module to notify CFM of a fault.
The undo oam-bind ingress vrrp vrid egress cfm md ma command disables VRRP from instructing the MGR module to notify CFM of a fault.
By default, VRRP is disabled from instructing the MGR module to notify CFM of a fault.
CLIs: oam-bind ingress vrrp vrid <vrid> interface { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> } egress cfm md <md-name> ma <ma-name>
undo oam-bind ingress vrrp vrid <vrid> interface { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> } egress cfm md <md-name> ma <ma-name>

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of a VRRP backup group.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.

Specifies the type and number of an interface.
-

Specifies the name of an MD.
The value is a string of 1 to 43 case-sensitive characters. Question marks (?), hyphens (-) are not supported.

Specifies the name of an MA.
The value is a string of 1 to 43 case-sensitive characters. Question marks (?), hyphens (-) are not supported. The total length of MA and MD names must be no greater than 44 characters.

Examples: [*HUAWEI-oam-mgr] oam-bind ingress vrrp vrid 1 interface GigabitEthernet1/0/1 egress cfm md mdcustomer ma macustomer
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To improve network reliability, associate CFM with VRRP. With this association, when CFM or VRRP detects a link fault, it instructs the MGR module to notify the other mechanism of the fault.
The association between CFM and VRRP can be unidirectional or bidirectional.
If the VRRP module detects a link fault, it instructs the CFM module to notify the remote end of the fault.If the CFM module detects a link fault, it instructs the VRRP module to perform a link switchover.
The following commands are used when CFM is associated with VRRP:
oam-bind cfm md ma vrrp vridoam-bind ingress cfm md ma egress vrrp vridoam-bind ingress vrrp vrid egress cfm md ma
